subject: Re: [junit] Problems on the Install: cannot run sample tests
msgSnippet: Please consult the FAQ. Google JUnit FAQ . Thanks. So said matthewmhoffman on 3/10/2003 -------------------- Hello! I just installed jUnit 3.8.1 this weekend.
messageBody:
Please consult the FAQ. Google "JUnit FAQ". Thanks.

So said matthewmhoffman on 3/10/2003 --------------------
Hello! I just installed jUnit 3.8.1 this weekend. I am running
WinXp pro (sp1) with j2sdk1.4.1_02. I unzipped the file
to c:\junit3.8.1

I added c:\junit3.8.1\junit.jar to my CLASSPATH and then
ran the sample code only to see the error:

java junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests

"class not found junit.samples.AllTests"

I've tried adjusting the path to include junit/samples/AllTests as
well as launching it within the directory but to no avail.

I know this is an incredibly stupid question--its about the test
sample after all!!--but then again, if I can't run the sample tests
(and I assure you that this is operator error) then I don't know if I
can be trusted to run real tests! If any one could fix the minor error
I am having, they will have my gratitude.

Thanks in advance for your help,

Matthew Hoffman
